tasks.task: Conducting Agroecological Farming through Farmer Field Schools
subtasks: Meeting regularly in the fields with fellow farmers
Discussing farming problems, innovations, and management techniques
Setting up and monitoring experimental plots
Making weekly observations of crops and soil health
Assessing plant diversity and its benefits
Recycling nutrients through livestock and composting
Applying principles of agroecology to improve soil health and biodiversity
Supporting each other to increase resilience against climate events and pests
Sharing knowledge about recycling procedures and economic benefits
Promoting diverse cropping systems and their microbe and insect benefits
Observing and experimenting with different farming methods
Adapting and innovating based on practical experiences
Building a deeper understanding of local agroecosystems
Increasing plant and tree diversity on farms
Enhancing nutritional value and income through year-round food production
Strengthening farms against pests and extreme weather
